It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia, where it thrives in moist, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Tetramerium angustius is often found in mangrove or coastal forests, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
